Package it.polimi.ingsw.msgUtilities.server

Class UpdateMsgWriter

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.msgUtilities.server.UpdateMsgWriter
public class UpdateMsgWriter
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains all the methods useful to write an XML schema message which represents a update to all clients from the server after an accepted request from one of these clients.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    UpdateMsgWriter()
    This constructor initializes the document with the standard XML schema content in updateMsg file (content in resources folder).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    org.w3c.dom.Document buildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y, int level)
    This method provides to format an update after a build request.

    This method provides to format an update after a choseGods request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document choseStartingPlayerUpdate​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String playerChosen)
    This method provides to format an update after a choseStartingPlayer request.

    This method provides to format an update after a createGods request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int level)
    This method is triggered when the player in turn's god is Medusa.
    org.w3c.dom.Document extraUpdate​(java.lang.String mode)
    This method writes an extraUpdate message, it sets only the mode.
    org.w3c.dom.Document loginUpdate​(java.lang.String user, Color c)
    This method provides to format an update after a login request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document loseUpdate​(java.lang.String loser, java.lang.String mode)
    This method writes a lose update when a player loses in a 3 players match.

    This method provides to format an update after a move request.

    This method writes under the two standard tags of the update message.

    This method provides to format an update after a setupOnBoard request.

    This method provides to format an update after a startGame request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document winLoseUpdate​(java.lang.String winner, java.lang.String mode)
    This method writes a Win or Lose update message when the match is a 2 player match.

  • Constructor Details

    • UpdateMsgWriter

      public UpdateMsgWriter()
      This constructor initializes the document with the standard XML schema content in updateMsg file (content in resources folder).

  • Method Details

    • setStandardUpdateValues

      public org.w3c.dom.Document setStandardUpdateValues​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String mod)
      This method writes under the two standard tags of the update message.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      mod - is the request mode (login, startGame...)
      Returns:
      the document updated

    • loginUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document loginUpdate​(java.lang.String user, Color c)
      This method provides to format an update after a login request. It sets the standard values and provides to report new player color and username.
      Parameters:
      user - is the new player username
      c - is the color assigned to the new player
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • startGameUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document startGameUpdate​(java.lang.String user)
      This method provides to format an update after a startGame request. It only sets standard values.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request.
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • createGodsUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document createGodsUpdate​(java.lang.String user, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> ids)
      This method provides to format an update after a createGods request. It sets standard values and provides to report the god's id list generated.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      ids - is the god's id list
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • choseGodUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document choseGodUpdate​(java.lang.String user, int godId)
      This method provides to format an update after a choseGods request. It sets standard values and provides to report the god chosen id.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      godId - is the chosen god id
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • choseStartingPlayerUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document choseStartingPlayerUpdate​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String playerChosen)
      This method provides to format an update after a choseStartingPlayer request. It sets standard values and provides to report the player chosen to start the match.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      playerChosen - is the player chosen to start the match
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • setupOnBoardUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document setupOnBoardUpdate​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y)
      This method provides to format an update after a setupOnBoard request. It sets standard values and provides to report the worker gender and the coordinates where user placed his worker.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      workerGender - is the worker user request to place on board gender
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • moveUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document moveUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y)
      This method provides to format an update after a move request. It sets only the updates after this move.
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that move generated
      startX - is the x coordinate where worker was before he moves
      startY - is the y coordinate where worker was before he moves
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • buildUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document buildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y, int level)
      This method provides to format an update after a build request. It sets only the updates after this built.
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that move generated
      startX - is the x coordinate where worker is when he builds
      startY - is the y coordinate where worker is when he builds
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed a new block
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed a new block
      level - is the level of the new block
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int level)
      This method is triggered when the player in turn's god is Medusa. This method provides to write updates after he finished his turn (if workers on board have been removed).
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that Medusa's power generated
      startX - is the x position where worker removed was
      startY - is the y position where worker removed was
      level - is the new block built instead of the worker removed
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • extraUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document extraUpdate​(java.lang.String mode)
      This method writes an extraUpdate message, it sets only the mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - is the extraUpdate mode
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • winLoseUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document winLoseUpdate​(java.lang.String winner, java.lang.String mode)
      This method writes a Win or Lose update message when the match is a 2 player match.
      Parameters:
      winner - is the player who won
      mode - indicate if the client who receive this message is the winner or the loser
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • loseUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document loseUpdate​(java.lang.String loser, java.lang.String mode)
      This method writes a lose update when a player loses in a 3 players match.
      Parameters:
      loser - is the player who loses
      mode - is the message mode
      Returns:
      the updated document
